meanings.definition: Mischievous or playful in a humorous way.
meanings.sent1: The waggish puppy kept stealing socks and running around the house.
meanings.sent2: The children's waggish behavior made everyone at the party laugh.
meanings.sent3: The waggish squirrel played a prank by hiding nuts in the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: His waggish sense of humor was like a mischievous imp whispering jokes in your ear.
meanings.sent5: The waggish grin on his face hinted at the playful mischief to come.

meanings.definition: Characterized by good-humored teasing or joking.
meanings.sent1: She appreciated his waggish comments that always brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's waggish remarks had the audience roaring with laughter.
meanings.sent3: His waggish banter with his friends lightened the mood during the stressful exam week.
meanings.sent4: The waggish tone of his voice was like a warm hug on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: Her waggish sense of humor was a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
